website_summaries.verdict: The cream of the crop. An excellent machine with superior performance.
pros: Large water tank provides ample steam
Loaded with intuitive features designed to make your job easier
cons: On the pricey side, though its high quality and durability may end up saving you money in the long run

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier!
customer_reviews.text: This product does what I expected it to do. Turns the cloths that are unwearable, into wearable ones. It’s not great for suits and some men’s bottom down shirts. Basically everything that is a pain to iron with a traditional iron, it would be hard to flatten out with this too, BUT for fabrics that shouldn’t be in direct contact with a metallic iron, because they will get an undesirable shine, or they might burn, this product will do great. Perfect for women’s clothing, t-shirts, delicate fabrics like silk and polyester, thin cotton, fancy dresses, kids clothing and more. It heats up fast and it won’t burn you with dripping hot water. I’m so glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: P.J. Price

customer_reviews.title: I was so disappointed because I loved the idea of the pull down ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. Massive design flaw with this model. You only get full steam if the hose is stretch upright. The hose is plastic and therefore crimps as you move it around causing the steam pressure and amount to decrease. I was so disappointed because I loved the idea of the pull down press support, but what good is a press support if you can’t get to the bottom of your garment.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Dagley

customer_reviews.title: Best Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I use my steamer almost every day. Far more convenient and easy to use than an iron. Heats up fast, and works great. Love the pull down screen to help steam items flat. I had another Rowenta steamer that this replaced after several years of daily use. Make sure you clean it regularly, especially if you have hard water, in order to avoid scale build up, and ensure long life.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Castillo

customer_reviews.title: We took good care of it all along and it was used ...
customer_reviews.text: We had this steamer for 14 months and it stopped producing steam. We took good care of it all along and it was used once a week. We called Rowenta customer service and they said the warranty is only for a year. We paid a higher price assuming we were getting a higher quality product but it turned out to be a bad product priced higher that other competitors. Highly recommend not to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: RAGHUNATH A VEETTIL

customer_reviews.title: My brand-new expensive Rowenta master valet Roland press sure does look used
customer_reviews.text: I have been busy working out of town and reset my got around to opening up my Rowenta master valet box there was a hole in the box and the box look like it possibly has been smashed with the wrinkles that are in the corkboard. The valet was out of the plastic bag with the bag at the bottom of the box the packages look to used there were surface scratches on the silver part of the unit. It appears to have been assembled a prior and disassembled for packaging and delivery to me. The unit does not look new. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie Reed Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: this did not get the job done at all. ...
customer_reviews.text: this did not get the job done at all. After spending 30 minutes on 1 shirt (cotton), the job was still not done. We returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a large amout of dress cloths...good idea.  If you only need once in a while, get a hand heldo9.
customer_reviews.text: The PLUS: The tank of water does last a good amount of time, not 90 minutes, but good. It does steam well, and eliminates the burden of ironing. The negatives; I expected a much sturdier product. I'm always worried it's going to fall over. The biggest issues though: The water hose gets really hot, and the steam handle gets even hotter. I purchased the steaming mittens, (I highly recommend buying these). Also, one of the attachment pieces doesn't stay on the handle either. I'm still in the decision phase as to whether I want to keep. It's clumsy to use. My husband isn't a fan of returning things.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Powers

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend to buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The steamer works good... but I can not leave any water in the tank because it will leak and all floor will be wet. It is very annoying because it was on the rug and rug became wet. The tank by itself (if you pull it out of the steamer) looks like it is not leaking, but if I leave it in the steamer, then it is leaking:(
customer_reviews.author: Rustam Rikhsiev

customer_reviews.title: Steamers cannot replace irons
customer_reviews.text: A friend told me "You don't have to iron ever again, get a steamer!" I did. This one. Probably one of the better ones. I was disillusioned. Please know even a very good steamer, which this one seems to be, will never do as good a job as an iron. A well steamed shirt looks like a ironed shirt that's been worn for an entire day - it's not wrinkled but it's tired. I'm sorry - It's just not as crisp. Also the clips on the hanger system for hanging pants are very week which made it nearly impossible to steam pants.
customer_reviews.author: Naama

customer_reviews.title: Better than handheld
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 handheld steamers, I dress office casual and every time I take something out of my closet it's wrinkled, then I have to take out the iron, board etc. The handheld steamers just took too long even on fabrics that should have been easy. I researched the best steamers and found the Rowenta Master Valet, it fits right in a corner. I started with a blouse and that took a couple swipes. Then I tried jeans that I haven't worn, I had air dried them and they were horribly wrinkled. Didn't take much to get the wrinkles out and I used the convenient lint brush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED ....
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this model in 2015 and used it once a week at most. It just died on me. I called customer service who directed me to the nearest repair center (30 miles from my home). Estimated repair cost of $50 to $100. Conclusion: this product has a built-in obsolescence of 2 years!
customer_reviews.author: MauriceJ

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but flawed is so many other ways
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good quality Cons: Steam isn't powerful enough and requires multiple passes Hanger isn't ergonomic and tends to create creases on shirts (atop) as you're trying to steam them straight Pant clips are useless, they fall right off Roller screen is a gimmick
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: The unit is difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased other Rowenta products which worked just fine. Unfortunately, this item is not really easy to use. First of all, the screen does not make it easy to steam anything longer than a blouse. I'm five feet, yet slacks and skirts fall lower than the screen. Secondly the hanging clips up top where you could hang an item do not hold anything heavier than a tissue! It's the worst Rowenta item I've ever used. Most times, I find I have to hold the item up in the air with one hand and steam with the other. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Buda

customer_reviews.title: A nice machine, with good results.
customer_reviews.text: Very glad I purchased this machine. It works very well, and heats up super fast. It's unfortunate that the hose isn't very long, as it doesn't allow for steaming curtains or bedding very well. I always empty out any remaining water and let it dry out after each use, as other reviews I've read said corrosion may occur from sitting moisture. So far so good, I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: SuperMOM

customer_reviews.title: Hose and cord could be longer
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it overall 4 stars was because the cord is short and the hose is also very short and it gets very hot. If you’re not careful you can easily burn yourself. Very difficult to get the wrinkles out of a backdrop set, since the hose does not reach.
customer_reviews.author: Fancy Face

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as an Iron
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews about how great it was and decided to get one. It doesn't work as well as an iron does. It removed some of the wrinkles immediately but once the steam had cooled some small wrinkles would reappear. If you are used to using an Iron this will not impress you. It doesn't leave crisp clean creases the way an iron does. If you never Iron and want a device that will remove some wrinkles you might appreciate it. After all ignorance is bliss.
customer_reviews.author: CNR

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product and leaks everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst steamer I’ve ever used. Yes it’s really nice looking and yes easy to assemble however the first time I used it, wokrked great and the 2nd and 3rd and 4th it left puddles of water underneath the it. Also the hose keeps getting bent when steaming and doesn’t allow the water to eavaporate out of the hose. Even moving the steamer when done to put away was still leaking every where. Awful product
customer_reviews.author: DAVID BENJAMIN

customer_reviews.title: Decent,  I probably should have gone with a regular pole.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I hate ironing. The steamer heats up incredibly fast. I want to say it's usable in less than 30 seconds. It works pretty well on thin fabrics, but not so well on thicker fabrics. The idea of the pull down screen is good in concept but the execution is poor. It's bulky and clumsy. The placement makes it slightly difficult to hang clothes for steaming. Due to the screen, it also does not store well even though you can shorten the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Tran

customer_reviews.title: only require filing o
customer_reviews.text: I needed a steamer and because I so loved my Rowenta Iron, I chose this. I've had the iron for 11 years with no problems. This steamer probably knocked four days off the job I had in front of me - ironing all the drapes before they were hung. It had enough capacity to only require filing it twice for 5 sets of floor to ceiling drapes. They look fantastic. I can't say that it will last as long as my iron, but I can say that now that I have the steamer, I can come up with other items to use it on./
customer_reviews.author: Gwyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a steam iron result.
customer_reviews.text: This garment steamer is great for removing creases and wrinkles from certain fabrics but it is limited. It simply cannot replace an iron when it comes to cotton button down shirts or other 100% cotton items. It will remove wrinkles from linen but will not give you the same results as an iron. I prefer sharp creases and no wrinkles on my clothes. The steamer is ready in 60 seconds and when in use provides a constant steam. Be warned: keep your helping hand below the steam handle or you might get scalded. It isn't serious enough for a first degree burn but it is hot. The tank is easy to refill. My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. The hand gets hot when you do steam after 10-15min or so. So i can't do big steam job at one day!! Steam is not that strong... It's not miracle like you see in the video.... And i am worried about getting molding where the water left in the hole after taking the wAter reservoir. I sometiems use kitchen towel to absorb water. Wish there is easier way to prevent molding! This is almost $200 value and this should be better designed.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this unit because of the positive ratings. I owned a very inexpensive unit of another brand and it did an excellent job, but it stopped working. When I plugged in the Rowenta, the steam was very strong and I was impressed with the design, but I tried to steam multiple garments, and I could not get good results. The very inexpensive steamer I had did a much better job. I am returning it for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Robin D.

customer_reviews.title: Pole is too short!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the height of the pole should be fully extended but I think I have mine fully extended and I'm a little under 5'3. I have to bend over to steam my sweaters. It was easy to put together and it seems to steam well but I don't like having to bend over to steam. I like to steam all of my cashmere when I get it out from storage and granted I have a lot of cashmere but my back hurts now. I bought this to replace the Rowenta Precision steamer I had that died. This one is no where near as good as that one.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this steamer. So glad after reading some of the negative reviews that I ordered it. Quick to steam! Yes taller would be nice but it allows me to be able to sit on a stool. The only thing is the clips to hang the pants is a bit awkward to clip. But I would definitely buy it again without a second thought. Great for a quick touch up too.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Fortin

customer_reviews.title: Good, durable steamer
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is great!!! Gets hot super fast, and steams my family’s clothes wonderfully. The only downside is that it doesn’t go up high enough. Since I’m short, it works fine, however I would not recommend this for a taller person. The clips on it do not work or keep clothes on them.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service and Great Steamer!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received looked used. I called Customer Service and had a new one by the next morning! The Customer Service representative was extremely helpful and accommodating, I had a time issue and had paid extra to receive it overnight so I was not happy. But my experience with Amazon, Customer Service and the Steamer ended up on a really great note. Thank you Amazon! I love the Steamer. It was just what I wanted. Easy to put together, easy to move and held enough water to steam for well over an hour. I find the Roll and Press feature invaluable and makes the steaming process easier and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Kerr/Cathleen Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Fraud/low quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought used. This seller should be banned. The unit had a broken water tank, lost screw in the handle so it couldn't be moved and no accessories. I would say these new probably don't hold up well either
customer_reviews.author: Deb Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Used very little
customer_reviews.text: I'm unhappy I was just using the steamer and I was lowering the pole and the latch broke. wish this pole was a little bit taller water tends to accumluate in the hose often, and theres always a little bit of water that sits at the bottom of the machine no way to get that out unless you turn the machine upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Too Short!! need to be able to adjust more for someone who is tall
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews but I thought I should regarding this purchase. My reason for giving it 4 stars is, I'm 5'7" I wish it I could adjust it to the height that would suit me. Not enoug length to adjust for someone that's tall other than that it's worth the investment
customer_reviews.author: Dark and Lovely

customer_reviews.title: Hoping they will make it good.
customer_reviews.text: bought it early for a wedding. Used it two days before wedding, June 16, and it worked for thirty minutes. A plastic piece melted. I just found out today, where I bought it. Hoping they will make it good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the summer with the thought of using it to wrinkle-out my fall/winter clothes. It was easy to assemble and when I fired it up, it made steam for about 10 minutes then quit, never to work again. I'm outside the return period, so am stuck with it. It might make a good scarecrow or I could hang targets on it for target practice.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should, but leaks water....
customer_reviews.text: Love the built in hanger and screen option... very nice feature. Overall the steamer performs well. My only problem with it, is that you can't fill up the water reservoir unless you are doing a lot of steaming at that time. It continues to release water when not in use, and over flows only the floor. I'm only able to use small amounts of water in the reservoir. Otherwise, it's a good product with excellent features. I probably should have returned it when I had the opportunity instead of dealing with it as is.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely efficiently for all Types of fabric. The roll and press helps a lot, I had other steamers without this that I had a hard time to remove all the wrinkles bc there was no place to press the clothes against. Check the measurement before buying it; it's a little bigger than it looks like. One thing that disappointed me, on the video is shows an accessory that doesn't come with the product, a crease attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Marina Lemos

customer_reviews.title: like maybe seventh grade
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had been alerted to these earlier in life.....like maybe seventh grade.....that's about the time vanity kicked in. A steamer is hugely different from ironing clothes. It's all in the steam....Think back and remember when you first heard about steaming vegetables ....life changing stuff this thing called steam....now you just wave it at your shirts and they come out cooked to perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerloose

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy from open stock again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an open container (read bought and returned) purchase. Other than the fact that it was disassembled so far that the manual was useless for putting it together it was fine. The hose had a kink/crushed area right at the handle, I don't know if that is a result of the used condition or is habitual for the product. In use the heat from the steam fixed the kink right up though.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryne Hooper

customer_reviews.title: leaks water
customer_reviews.text: leaks water when not in use called customer service and they told me it common to leak don't use it on wood floors need to repair my new floor
customer_reviews.author: LOUIS RIVAS

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Who ever designed this is needs to know that they provide some way to really steam shirts , just does not work. The clips that hold the shirts is bad, design is bad.
customer_reviews.author: easren

customer_reviews.title: Loved it - but missing a piece
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer ( my second one), but the pole was missing a piece (should have three retractable parts to make it tall enough). Luckily I kept my old one, so just used the pole from that one instead. This steamer replaced my old one that stopped working. I liked it enough to buy again. Since the pole from my old one was still good and I needed to use it right away, I just used that part from my old one and didn't bother returning it due to the missing part.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful steamer !
customer_reviews.text: Much much much better than the handheld one. I feel like this is one that they use at a dry cleaners LOL. Saves hours a month
customer_reviews.author: Bear evans

customer_reviews.title: Okay steamer, with two main annoying issues
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality is okay. The steamer does its job fast and effectively. The build quality is solid and assembling things together is easy. However, this product has two main problems we encountered: 1. The clips on the hanger are so weak and essentially useless to hold anything up. I never actually used them as a result. 2. The steamer handle gets *very* hot when in use. It seems to have very bad insulation and sometimes I had to use oven gloves to hold the handle in order not to get burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Mi

customer_reviews.title: Better than ironing
customer_reviews.text: I have this streamer for 7 months now and still work perfectly ,, easy to assemble ,, easy to use ,, and i use it a lot ,, i even recommended it to a friend and family ,, finally no more ironing it’s even better ,, i use to have very hard time to iron flat some shirts specially the white ones because i wash it with hot water so they got too wrinkled But not anymore with this streamer my shirts are flat in no time 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: mariam

customer_reviews.title: It work like it should. A cloth steamer, not commercial grade.
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out today. It take about 5 minutes to warm up and generate some steam. It doesn't completely remove wrinkle, just reduce or less noticeable wrinkle. I used on sport coat, dress pants and dress shirt. If you want wrinkle free look, I would suggest a good steam clothing iron not this. Overall expectation, it did the job to reduce wrinkle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What’s up with the clips?
customer_reviews.text: As a family we use the steamer every weekday, work clothes and school uniforms. Fast way to get rid of wrinkles. However, not sure what’s up with the the clips to clip your pants on the steam them as pants any pants just seem to fall right off! So I have to just use regular hanger. Steamer is expensive so I would think it would come with usable clips...
customer_reviews.author: allie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but telescopic pole no longer stays extended
customer_reviews.text: Our first steamer. Easy to use. Some materials steam more easily than others. After only a year the telescopic pole isn’t staying extended which means I’m steaming on mu knees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst steamer ever
customer_reviews.text: This piece of garbage cannot steam press butter. It is totally a waste of money. The esthetics is beautiful but it is like a white elephant in my home. I tried it out once when setting it up. It is a total fail!!!! I will be throwing it out with the garbage since its taking up space in my home
customer_reviews.author: KAREN MONAH

customer_reviews.title: This new one seemed so good I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: I had a Rowenta steamer but when moving the bar broke. This new one seemed so good I ordered it. It leaked all over..thank goodness it was a hardwood floor or it would've soaked a carpet. Read the reviews always, I just assumed it would be like my other one but better..nope. I returned it ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: great steamer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older version of this ( because i didn't take care of it and descale... my bad) but its quick , light and works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Small

customer_reviews.title: I Will Never Iron Again!
customer_reviews.text: I have always hated ironing! This is a joy to use. It is my favorite household appliance. It makes all of my clothes look like they did when they were brand new, especially on casual items like T-shirts that I would never put the time into ironing. It is fast and easy to use. The press and roll feature provides support so you can actually "press" the wrinkles and put a crease into your pants. I bought it when my son got married. The bridesmaids ordered chiffon dresses that arrived in an extreme wrinkled state. I used the Rowenta on them and the wrinkles in the fragile chiffon fabric vanished like magic. I LOVE this product!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to move around
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I ordered this and I have had it for about 6 months now, overall a great product, but it is very heavy and difficult to move around, it takes more space than I would like but does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Stitch21

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer, I use it nearly everyday. It's really wonderful on so many front. It heats quickly, is silent for the most part. The garment rack is great and the clips are very useful . I only gave it 4 stars because I ordered the purple one and was sent the brown.. YUCK.. But the unit itself is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Paris

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied and happy with this acquisition
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied and happy with this acquisition. It works great and easy to use. I have mention the company contact me before I received the item. And they asked me if I was unhappy with the purchase they would be ready for resolve it before I write my review. I really did not need to contact the company but it seems a nice touch from them worry about customer satisfaction even before receiving the product.
customer_reviews.author: itzamna

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this steamer. It works extremely well on most of our clothes. I still iron our jeans and t-shirts (yeah I'm crazy that way). It even works very well on button down shirts. It's the best thing ever for my and my daughters boutique tops and dresses and my son's active wear. Love it! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Doesnt work like traditional iron
customer_reviews.text: Your hands will start hurting but clothes wont be wrinkle free. I thought it will be great for morning use just before the office. But it seems my traditional iron does a much much better job than this fancy one. I have started the return process.
customer_reviews.author: Anshumali

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for son in law. He has a shirt/tie job vs old job wearing a uniform. He didn't know what an iron was for before! He LOVES this. He just hangs shirts after about 5 min in dryer and then uses it every morning. Best gift ever. Works way better than less expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: Toady

customer_reviews.title: A good one...
customer_reviews.text: The Rowenta Master Valet is great and I loved it. The roll and press garment holder was a plus. Only thing I would say is the height of the steamer needed to be longer because I would have to bend down to steam press the bottom of the garment. Overall, great purchase and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this product steaming is a breeze and use is simple ,wrinkles are gone with just a few strokes
customer_reviews.author: JENNINE LARA

customer_reviews.title: Laundry's new best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Makes laundry day(s) much easier! It's quick and easy to be wrinkle free with this device. Highly recommend this time and space saver!
customer_reviews.author: HeidiBrandow

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is a game changer. I hate ironing and I don't wear a lot of my clothes because of wrinkles. My husband got this for me and I steam out everything now. Easy to use. My 12 year old daughter uses it to steam out her clothes too. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Travaglia

customer_reviews.title: Best steamer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this steamer. It is designed to work with tap water and does a fantastic job. I'm a professional home stager and I'm constantly steaming linens and draperies. Wish the corded wand was a bit longer, but otherwise very happy with the product. Nice quality and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Good quality. Easy to assemble and easy to use. The added pull down screen to steam garments against helps get out wrinkles and press in creases. The clips are an asset as well. Better than your conventional clothes steamer. Costs a little more but is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: apm

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! It leaks a lot. At first ...
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY! It leaks a lot. At first I thought i did not close the tank properly. Finally put up on the picnic table and saw water pouring out of the bottom. Hopefully i can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Rowbo

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that the chord isn’t a pull and I like the product because it is very useful for silky product and you don’t have to gauge settings
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Ramsay

customer_reviews.title: ... as described and I can not be without this amazing tool! I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as described and I can not be without this amazing tool! I love it!!! It does get noisy at times, but does the job well! The only thing I would say in the back where you keep the water it does leak into it's place no matter how tight you tighten it or what you do. I make sure I clean the water out when I am done. At times it's a bit stubborn getting wrinkles out. For me it's the best one out there and it does everything for me!
customer_reviews.author: Haleh

customer_reviews.title: ... been okay so far but the two clamps are super annoying to use
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this and it's been okay so far but the two clamps are super annoying to use. They aren't nearly far enough apart so it is difficult to do larger or lengthier things.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: More frustration than peace&ease
customer_reviews.text: There are two bad things about this steamer: 1) the clips do not hold the pants at all. The pants fall off very easily during steaming; 2) the steamer is so short that you will find yourself bending down all the time. My back hurts so bad after doing 2-3 shirts. It creates a lot of hassle and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pull-down Roll & Press screen was useful, but didn't significantly improve the quality of the ...
customer_reviews.text: The steamer produces steam quickly enough; however the steamer head became hot to the touch after only a few minutes of use. The pull-down Roll & Press screen was useful, but didn't significantly improve the quality of the steaming performance. The self-hanging clips were somewhat awkward to use. Overall, I didn't like this steamer more than the Precision ValetTM Full Size Garment Steamer I'm replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Furbee

customer_reviews.title: Good steamer
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. It heats very quickly and does a good job. It is a bit bulky but I can deal with this.

product_meta.title: Rowenta Master Valet IS6300 Professional Grade, Clothes Garment Steamer, Built-in Hanger, Brown
product_meta.description: Style Name:1550-Watts with Press ScreenQuickly remove wrinkles from any type of fabric with this powerful Rowenta IS6300U2 Master Valet full-size garment steamer—perfect for steaming hanging garments, upholstery, curtains, slipcovers, and more. In addition to smoothing out wrinkles, it also works well for sanitizing, killing germs, reducing dust mites, and eliminating smoke and other odors from fabrics and various home furnishings. Unlike other full-size garment steamers, the 1550-watt Master Valet features exclusive Roll and Press vertical support, which offers a convenient flat surface for garments to press against, helping to hold them in place, hands-free, while steaming. The garment steamer also provides a large built-in hanger, rotating garment clips, and a hanger hook for your own hanger. Its large steam head emits high-volume powerful steam with a wide diffusion for fast, efficient results. The garment steamer’s extra-large transparent water tank allows for checking on water levels at a glance, and the tank holds up to 81 ounces of regular tap water and can be removed for easy filling. On a full tank, the garment steamer produces up to an hour of continuous steam. Complete projects from start to finish without having to stop and refill. Even more, the garment steamer’s telescopic aluminum pole offers adjustable height for comfortable steaming and pushes down for compact storage when not in use. Other highlights include a flexible fabric hose, a foot-operated on/off switch, large back wheels, and a suitcase-style tilt-and-roll configuration for simple transport. Accessories include a fabric brush for efficiency, a lint pad for a clean finish, and a steam bonnet to protect delicate items. Save time and money by reducing trips to the dry cleaners with the Rowenta IS6300U2 Master Valet full-size garment steamer. Power: 1500W.
